intro: Byttneria echinata, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its smooth, light-gray bark and large, heart-shaped leaves. Due to its hard wood, it has been historically valued for timber and traditional uses.
